Teddi, That's not necissarily true. The new "HST" tax is 13%. This is the only tax that people will be paying. The previous tax rates were 8% for PST and 5% for GST. There's very little difference. HOWEVER, the good thing is that the "rebate" will now be half of the 13% instead of half of the 5%. There are a few ways to qualify for the rebate, but you basically need to use certain "services". Also, you trip must be a "package"... which means everything included in one lump price. Services include: transportation, guide, interpreter, sightseeing excursions, and ski lessons
You will have to pay taxes on things that were previously exempt however. From what I understand, Guides and other previously untaxed services will now be taxed.
there are a lot of things that are now going to be taxed at 13%. as you said guides and other services. also the price of gas is going to be taxed as well at 13% instead of 5%.
